title.narrative: (903.1) CHILDREN'S RIGHT TO SOCIAL PROTECTION

description.narrative: CHILDREN'S RIGHT TO SOCIAL PROTECTION - a) Child poverty measured and monitored and increasingly translated into effective social protection policy responses, including through increasing the number of children (in the poorest quintile, and among socially vulnerable groups such as migrants, minorities and children with disabilities) receiving regular and predictable social transfers and b) Integrated models of social protection for cash and care to the most vulnerable children are developed., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Partners supported to provide supportive and caring environment for all children, especially the most vulnerable, focusing on prevention measures

participating-org.narrative: ARISTOTELIO PANEPISTIMIO THESSALONI EIDIKOS LOGARIASMOS KONDILION EREVN

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Linking cash to other programs, information and services (information on essential family practices, livelihoods, psycho-social support, etc.)
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: CHILDREN?S RIGHT TO SOCIAL PROTECTION - a) Child poverty measured and monitored and increasingly translated into effective socialprotection policy responses, including through increasing the number of children (in the poorest quintile, and among sociallyvulnerable groups such as migrants, minorities and children with disabilities) receiving regular and predictable social transfers;and b) Integrated models of social protection for cash and care to the most vulnerable children are developed.

description.narrative: Progress has been achieved in all areas: two countries have published new child poverty figures; three countries have announced reforms to increase the number of children benefiting from social transfers or the value of transfers; six country offices have generated evidence to improve budget allocations and expenditures for children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:09/01/2019
